verses.kjv: Now Hiram king of Tyre sent messengers to David, and timber of cedars, with masons and carpenters, to build him an house.
verses.ct: Hiram king of Tyre sent representatives to David, along with cedar logs, stonemasons, and carpenters to build a palace for him.

verses.kjv: And David perceived that the LORD had confirmed him king over Israel, for his kingdom was lifted up on high, because of his people Israel.
verses.ct: David recognized that the LORD had firmly established him as king over Israel, and that his kingdom had been raised to greatness for the sake of his people Israel.

verses.kjv: And David took more wives at Jerusalem: and David begat more sons and daughters.
verses.ct: David married additional wives in Jerusalem, and David became the father of more sons and daughters.

verses.kjv: Now these are the names of his children which he had in Jerusalem; Shammua, and Shobab, Nathan, and Solomon,
verses.ct: These are the names of the children born to him in Jerusalem: Shammua, Shobab, Nathan, Solomon,

verses.kjv: And Ibhar, and Elishua, and Elpalet,
And Nogah, and Nepheg, and Japhia,
And Elishama, and Beeliada, and Eliphalet.
And when the Philistines heard that David was anointed king over all Israel, all the Philistines went up to seek David. And David heard of it, and went out against them.
verses.ct: When the Philistines learned that David had been anointed king over all Israel, their entire army marched out to find him. David got word of this and went out to confront them.

verses.kjv: And the Philistines came and spread themselves in the valley of Rephaim.
verses.ct: The Philistines arrived and spread out across the valley of Rephaim.

verses.kjv: And David enquired of God, saying, Shall I go up against the Philistines? And wilt thou deliver them into mine hand? And the LORD said unto him, Go up; for I will deliver them into thine hand.
verses.ct: David asked God, 'Should I attack the Philistines? Will you give me victory over them?' The LORD told him, 'Attack them, because I will hand them over to you.'

verses.kjv: So they came up to Baalperazim; and David smote them there. Then David said, God hath broken in upon mine enemies by mine hand like the breaking forth of waters: therefore they called the name of that place Baalperazim.
verses.ct: So they advanced to Baalperazim, and David defeated them there. Then David said, 'God has used me to burst through my enemies like a flood breaking through a dam.' That is why they named that place Baalperazim.

verses.kjv: And when they had left their gods there, David gave a commandment, and they were burned with fire.
verses.ct: The Philistines abandoned their gods there, and David ordered that they be burned.

verses.kjv: And the Philistines yet again spread themselves abroad in the valley.
verses.ct: The Philistines once again spread out across the valley.

verses.kjv: Therefore David enquired again of God; and God said unto him, Go not up after them; turn away from them, and come upon them over against the mulberry trees.
verses.ct: So David asked God again, and God told him, 'Don't go straight after them. Instead, circle around and approach them from the opposite side of the balsam trees.'

verses.kjv: And it shall be, when thou shalt hear a sound of going in the tops of the mulberry trees, that then thou shalt go out to battle: for God is gone forth before thee to smite the host of the Philistines.
verses.ct: 'When you hear the sound of marching in the tops of the balsam trees, then launch your attack, because God will have gone ahead of you to strike down the Philistine army.'

verses.kjv: David therefore did as God commanded him: and they smote the host of the Philistines from Gibeon even to Gazer.
verses.ct: David did exactly what God commanded him, and they struck down the Philistine army all the way from Gibeon to Gazer.

verses.kjv: And the fame of David went out into all lands; and the LORD brought the fear of him upon all nations.
verses.ct: David's reputation spread throughout every nation, and the LORD caused all the surrounding peoples to dread him.
